Commentary Text: Prasidh to Unadkat, out Bowled!! RR won't play out their quota of overs. That was a slower delivery and the batsman went for the slog sweep but was outdone by the lack of pace on it. The batsman knelt down, may be guessed the pace right, but could not connect at all for the LED bails to lighten up. KKR camp is chuffed. So is the crowd and the entire team. The on-field umpire did check for a no-ball but it is KKR's evening and nothing can go wrong. Unadkat b Prasidh 26(18) [4s-3 6s-1]
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Prasidh to Anureet Singh, 1 run, another full toss, a low dipping one and the batsman thwacks the ball away to deep cover for a single. Five singles in the over

RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI. Commentary Text: A Russell to Unadkat, no run, dropped! That was a short ball, quick one and that big on him. The top-edge ballooned up and the man from cover - Krishna - came in and fluffed it. That should have been gobbled up but RR survive to fight another day
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: A Russell to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Another one bites the dust. KKR fans find their voices again. Short ball, rising up and the batsman trying to pull it away, managed only a lot of height. The man at deep square leg came in and took it, not exactly with a lot of ease but effectively in the end. Might have lost it in the lights. Jofra Archer c Shubman Gill b A Russell 6(5) [4s-1]
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav

Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Prasidh to Jofra Archer, FOUR, not a bad start! Short ball at the body and pulled away into the on-side for a four. The man at fine leg had no chance. He played it slightly late but did well to get enough meat on it

Commentary Text: Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, out Caught by Karthik!! The yorkerish delivery was jammed out and it popped up. KKR think it went off the boot and into the keeper's gloves. They may be right!! It seems the batsman did jam it out off the inner half of the bat but into his boot. And then it went up for DK to take it and bring to the notice of the umpires that they should go upstairs. They did, the soft signal was not out but was not to be as the replays were conclusive enough for the third umpire to make the decision. Ish Sodhi c Karthik b Prasidh 1(6)
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav

Commentary Text: Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, no run, slower delivery and angles in @103kph. The batsman again looks to hoick across the line and misses it. Very very ordinary from the Kiwi
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Commentary Text: Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, phew! That was close. Shortish, again slightly turning in and the cut is played off the top-half of the bat. The man at backward point leapt up but still could not even get finger-tips to it. 10 runs of the over and RR fight on thanks to this cameo from Unadkat. Narine ends a decent spell - 4-0-29-1

Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out. Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008. Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! The last straw is gone. RR will drown it seems. Too full, flighted as well and the toe-ended push finds the bowler. The bowler stays low and pouches it. DK and team erupt. A hattrick against Aussies and now this. Kuldeep can't do anything wrong at the Eden. A 4-fer in a big game. Stokes ends a horron run in the IPL. He has been off-color throughout and it has ended like that as well. Stokes c and b Kuldeep Yadav 11(13)

But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out. Commentary Text: Shivam Mavi to Gowtham, out Caught by Karthik!! The pace has the last laugh. Disconcerting bounce coupled with it forces an almost evasive action from Gowtham, who fails to get his gloves out of the way. The ball flicked the gloves and went up for the keeper to take it with ease. The Eden is alive and noisy. Eden has witnessed many collapses and this one is dear to KKR. Gowtham c Karthik b Shivam Mavi 3(5)

In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
