team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
toss: Kolkata Knight Riders have won the toss and have opted to field
winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Gowtham, 1 run, DK ain't a happy man. That was misfielded by the bowler and DK makes annoyance known to the bowler. Another flighted ball and the batsman knocked it back to the bowler, who fumnbled it

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Binny, out Stumped!! The googly and RR implode further. The batsman predictably does not read it. Looks to whip a flighted ball outside off and misses it. The ball turned away past the blade and DK does the rest. He whipped the bails off in a flash. Kuldeep leaps up in his celebratory jump. The spinners are choking their opponents here. You have seen this script from KKR. Haven't you?Binny st Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 1(4)

Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
toss: Kolkata Knight Riders have won the toss and have opted to field
winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Narine to Samson, out Lbw!! The flattish ball spun in sharply and hit the batsman high on the back leg. Looks a little high. Was there an inside edge? NO! The height is not an issue. Three Reds. RR are going down like a lead balloon. The ball skidded on and the batsman was late on the attempted swat on the on-side. This is tragedy for RR. From 59 in 4 overs to this. T20 cricket and its speed taking a toll on RR. In dire straits. Samson lbw b Narine 12(10) [4s-2]
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
toss: Kolkata Knight Riders have won the toss and have opted to field
winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, perfect length, but it doesn't matter which variation it was, Samson reaches out and sweeps it hard to backward square leg for four. Incredible shot, and four...
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh

KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, out Caught by Searles!! Massive moment! Fullish one, too full to reverse, Buttler goes for it anyway, and gets it off the top half of the bat, and lobs it to Searles at short third man. A tame end to an otherwise excellent innings, and Buttler's streak of 5 consecutive 50s comes to an end. 3 down, and Kuldeep has made an important breakthrough. Buttler c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 39(22) [4s-5 6s-2]

IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
toss: Kolkata Knight Riders have won the toss and have opted to field
winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, full delivery outside off pushed to cover off the front foot
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

Commentary Text: Prasidh to Samson, no run, very full, falls short of the yorker length,on middle, Samson waits for it and gets under the ball to push it back to the bowler from the crease. An offer to hit the batsman by the bowler, but he pulls out at the last moment. Sanju doesn't flinch...

While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
toss: Kolkata Knight Riders have won the toss and have opted to field
winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, half-cook, on the pads, a whip away to mid-wicket for a scampered single
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
toss: Kolkata Knight Riders have won the toss and have opted to field
winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Bowled!! Oh, it's ugly when a batsman with a Test hundred in almost every country tries circus tricks. Kuldeep fires in the googly on middle and leg, Rahane gets across his stumps and tries to whack it away behind point with a reverse sweep, misses it altogether and ends up making a fool of himself. The furniture is knocked over, and a the flashing red bails reflect ominous signs for RR. Rahane b Kuldeep Yadav 11(12) [4s-1]

Commentary Text: Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 2 runs, the orthodox chinaman, headed outside off, Rahane gets on his knees and fetches that with a hard sweep from outside off. Gets it in front of deep square leg for a brace

Commentary Text: A Russell to Buttler, no run, how often do you see this? An outswinging full-toss headed for the box, fired in @142.3kmph, Buttler is vigilant as he plays it late and manages to keep it down. Wonder why he looks relieved...

With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more. Commentary Text: A Russell to Rahane, no run, fuller one on middle, Rahane makes room and whacks it to cover, where Uthappa cuts it off. Saved a certain boundary. Incredibly quick work...
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.

winner: Kolkata Knight Riders won by 6 wkts

Commentary Text: Narine to Rahane, FOUR, shortish off-break, erring in line, drifting into the pads, whipped away off the back foot to the backward square leg fence for four. Threaded the needle there...
team_a_11: Kolkata Knight Riders (Playing XI): Chris Lynn, Sunil Narine, Robin Uthappa, Andre Russell, Dinesh Karthik(w/c), Nitish Rana, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, Prasidh Krishna, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav
team_b_11: Rajasthan Royals (Playing XI): Jos Buttler(w), Ajinkya Rahane(c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Rahul Tripathi, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Jaydev Unadkat, Ish Sodhi, Anureet Singh
team_a_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability. Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
team_b_subs: Preview by Akash Sarkar   Rajasthan Royals land in Kolkata on the back of three consecutive, dominating and extremely impressive wins. Their run has meant they've surged to the fifth spot just behind Kolkata Knight Riders, their opponents on Tuesday (May 14), and look good for a late surge into the Top 4.  Both KKR and RR will walk into the contest with similar objectives. The luxury to drop points is now gone and a slip could well prove fatal at the stage this tournament is right now. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna. Both teams, despite their resounding win in the previous encounter, have plenty of issues and are far from polished products heading into the business end of IPL 2018.  RR have done well to give the teams in the top half a major scare. While Sunrisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs, Ajinkya Rahane and his batch of 2018 have left KKR, Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Kings XI Punjab sweating. But all three wins have come on the back of Jos Buttler. The opener has bailed the team out and managed to push it over the line single-handedly with very little contributions from the other batsmen.  Misfiring Ben Stokes and the fact that Sanju Samson has lost a bit of form should worry the think-tank. The fact that Rahane too hasn't played an innings of substance in the last five games shows there's a major weakness - one that KKR will look to target. Jos Buttler threat looms large and the first thing KKR will aim to do is get rid of him. If they can't, the focus will shift to minimising the damage and squeezing other batsmen. KKR can take heart from Buttler's good run as well.  KKR have lacked the consistency but have done well to bounce back from desperate situations. After the thrashing by MI, they did well to cruise past KXIP in Indore. With a win behind them, it's crucial that they find a way to sustain the momentum. That, however, is easier said than done. RR, with the kind of form they are in, are more than capable of hurting KKR's bouncebackability.  Both teams held an optional practice session on the eve of the game but most from KKR's first XI turned up to show they mean business. KKR play their last game in Hyderabad against ominous looking SRH. RR head back home to play against fearless RCB. Both teams are desperate to not leave it for too late. That being said, one team, will certainly leave Kolkata hurting a lot more.  When: Tuesday, May 15, 2018  Where: Eden Gardens, Kolkata  What to expect: There has been plenty of rain in the city leading up to the game but things remained clear on the eve of the clash. There's rain forecast on match day as well.  Team news  Kolkata Knight Riders: Shivam Mavi continues to struggle with the finger injury he picked up in the game against CSK. Though he bowled in the nets, Jacques Kallis, the coach, confirmed they are going to make a last minute call on his availability. If he does get fit, KKR will have to deal with another headache given Prasidh Krishna's impressive performance with the ball in Indore where batsmen dominated the game. With pace and bounce in the pitch, KKR might just move away from their strategy of playing three spinners - meaning one of Kuldeep Yadav or Piyush Chawla might have to sit out.  Probable XI: Sunil Narine, Chris Lynn, Robin Uthappa, Nitish Rana, Dinesh Karthik (c & wk), Andre Russell, Shubman Gill, Javon Searles, two of Kuldeep Yadav, Shivam Mavi and Piyush Chawla, Prasidh Krishna.  Rajasthan Royals: The bounce in the pitch is something D'Arcy Short is certainly going to enjoy and the conditions could just work in his favour. Just one spot is likely to be debated in the team meeting but it's highly likely they will go in with an unchanged XI.  B6$ D'Arcy Short, Jos Buttler (wk), Ajinkya Rahane (c), Sanju Samson, Ben Stokes, Stuart Binny, Jofra Archer, Krishnappa Gowtham, Shreyas Gopal, Jaydev Unadkat, Dhawal Kulkarni.  Head to Head  KKR 7 - 7 RR (Two ties, both won by RR)  Team Record at Eden Gardens  KKR 4 - 1 RR  RR have lost their last five IPL games at the Eden with their only win here coming in 2008.  Interesting face-offs  Narine vs Rahane: Narine has dismissed Rahane thrice in 44 balls conceding 59 runs. Other RR batsmen have generally struggled against Narine with Buttler scoring 26 off 24 (one dismissal), Stokes 13 off 13 (one dismissal) and Samson 21 off 26 (two dismissals).  IPL 2018 trends  KKR and RR have been two of the weakest bowling sides this IPL - KKR in terms of ER (9.41) and RR in terms of wickets captured (60).  In the five matches in May, Buttler has scored 48.38% of the total runs RR have made in the five games (389/804).  Russell has a strike rate of 196.15 against pace this IPL but has got out to pace nine times. In comparison, he has faced only 31 deliveries of spin without getting dismissed but strikes at only 145.16 against them.  What they said:  "We haven't looked at other teams. We have the destiny in our hands and if we play two good games then we go into the playoffs. We have to take it one game at a time. (First up) play well tomorrow, try and get away with a win and then worry about the other game. As far as rest of the teams are concerned, we are not really worried about what they are doing" - Jacques Kallis.
